result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah D Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Noah D Miller in court.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Noah D Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Discovery and offer received. Possible suppression motion coming. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
2:49 PM (64-06) Defendant Noah D Miller in court.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for James B. Duquette  for Noah D Miller.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin  ADA J.J. Crawford in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Hilton acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived its reading and plead not guilty to the charge.




adj. 2:51PM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Case called 8:55 AM. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah D Miller not in court.  Attorney Jacob Hilton for James B. Duquette in court for Noah D Miller. Attorney Duquette has not been able to contact defendant. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Case re-called at 9:13 AM. Defendant is now present. Attorney Duquette appears by phone. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah D Miller in court. Must fill out form and get notarized at COC. MFAC granted. $200 per month beginning 8/1/2022. Court advised defendant that he must be booked and printed. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah D Miller in court. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State's Summons Cover Letter to  Defendant
